meanings.sent1: The neumic symbols were used to represent different musical notes.
meanings.sent2: She studied the neumic markings to understand the ancient music better.
meanings.sent3: The neumic patterns on the page looked like tiny, mysterious drawings.
meanings.sent4: The neumic language of music spoke to her soul in a way words never could.
meanings.sent5: The neumic style of notation added a unique charm to the medieval compositions.

meanings.definition: A symbol representing one or more notes in Gregorian chant.
meanings.sent1: The neumic indicated the pitch and duration of each note in the chant.
meanings.sent2: During the performance, the singers followed the neumic closely.
meanings.sent3: The neumic on the parchment seemed to dance as the choir sang.
meanings.sent4: The neumic floated in the air, carrying the melody to the heavens.
meanings.sent5: The neumic stood out on the page, guiding the singers through the music.

meanings.definition: A type of musical notation used in medieval music.
meanings.sent1: The neumic system helped musicians read and interpret the ancient scores.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, composers relied on neumic to notate their music.
meanings.sent3: The neumic on the manuscript looked like a secret code waiting to be deciphered.
meanings.sent4: The neumic on the page whispered the melodies of the past to those who could read them.
meanings.sent5: The neumic characters on the parchment added a touch of mystery to the musical piece.
